active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a group discussion, debate the consequences of role ambiguity in cybersecurity (e.g., overlapping AO and Senior Management duties). Use NIST RMF examples to argue how clear assignments prevent risk escalation, and propose solutions like RACI matrices. Reference prior knowledge from project management hierarchies.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

distractor_protocol.step: Identify common misconceptions about the topic
Ensure distractors are similar in length and complexity
Include partial truths that require deeper understanding

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in Personnel Security (NIST-aligned). Topic: 'Roles and Responsibilities Assignment' (Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Security And Risk Management > Personnel Security > Personnel Security Governance and Policy > Policy Development and Management > Roles and Responsibilities Assignment). Consensus: 85.7% approval on completeness/pedagogy. Key Content (from NIST SP 800-53, RMF Quick Start Guide https://csrc.nist.gov/csrc/media/Projects/risk-management/documents/Additional%20Resources/NIST%20RMF%20Roles%20and%20Responsibilities%20Crosswalk.pdf): - Senior Mgmt: Sets goals, allocates resources, designates officials. - AO: Authorizes systems, accepts residual risk, oversees RMF. - ISSO: Implements/monitors controls. - System Owner: Manages system lifecycle. - Control Assessor: Assesses control effectiveness. - CISO: Leads security program. - Risk Executive: Enterprise risk strategy. Use scaffolding: Layer 1 (definitions), Layer 2 (relationships/RACI), Layer 3 (assignment steps), Layer 4 (RMF integration). Learning Objectives: [Insert the 6 objectives from above]. Active Learning Tie-Ins: Reference discussions (role ambiguity risks), peer teaching (role explanations), problem-solving (scenario assignments). Generate 40 Anki-style flashcards following this exact schema: { "flashcard_id": 1, "type": "MCQ|Cloze|ShortAnswer", "front": "Question text", "back": { "answer": "Correct answer", "explanation": "Full rationale with NIST source, misconception debunk, Bloom's/scaffolding links.", "bloom_level": "REMEMBER", "scaffolding_layer": "Layer 1", "distractors": ["D1", "D2", "D3"] // For MCQs only } } Output ONLY a JSON array of flashcards. Ensure variety: 16 basic, 12 applied, 12 advanced. Distractors: Plausible per protocol (role overlaps, partial truths). Sources: NIST SP 800-53, RMF Guide (full URLs).
